alert.note: Alert for York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 06 at 8:31AM EDT until September 06 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Southeastern York County in Pennsylvania. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 829 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Delta, Sunnyburn, Holtwood, Susquehanna Trails, Fawn Grove, Airville and Peach Bottom. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
